DataElement.preferredName: Non-protocol Cancer Treatment Concurrent Clinical Trial Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Administered Ind-3
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether non-protocol cancer treatment given during protocol treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-protocol Cancer Treatment Concurrent Clinical Trial Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the administration of treatment for a malignant neoplasm that is not part of the action plan for a clinical trial given at the same time as treatment for a malignant neoplasm that is part of the action plan for a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.
Any intervention for management of a malignant neoplasm.

Property.preferredName: Concurrent Clinical Trial Protocol Therapeutic Procedure Administered
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 4-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/35/2016 jk removed "indeterminate" value that was added in error. 7/7/2021wz: added ALT VM name for HOPE-CARE project.
